The giant cross-continental telescope is expected to produce scientific results that will change our understanding of the universe. The organization is headquartered in the United Kingdom and has 14 members. After construction completion, the two complementary telescopes will be the ears on either side of the planet, allowing us to listen to those murmurings from the deep universe which are driving such excitement in both science and deeper our understanding of the universe in which we live and the origins of life more than 130 000 of the christmas tree shaped antennas will be built in western australia on traditional lands of the Wajari Aboriginal people, while in South Africa the site will feature nearly 200 dishes in the remote Karoo region.

Brazil trained ahead of their last 16 clash against South Korea and there was only one name on everyone's lips, Neymar. After picking up an ankle injury in the group stages, the PSG player is set to return to the side and play in some capacity. Whether or not he'll start remains to be seen. South Korea advanced after a shock 2-1 snatch-and-grab victory over Portugal. They have not advanced past the last 16 since their historic run in 2002, when they reached the semi-finals as co-hosts of the tournament.
